actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to restore the record-keeping requirement of the Child Protection and Obscenity Enforcement Act of 1988.

summary.text: Amends the Federal criminal code to restore specified recordkeeping requirements of the Child Protection and Obscenity Enforcement Act of 1988. Requires producers of any book, magazine, periodical, film, videotape, or other matter which contains one or more visual depictions, made after the effective date of this Act, of actual sexually explicit conduct to: (1) maintain records on every performer portrayed in such visual depiction; (2) ascertain their name and date of birth; and (3) affix a statement of the location of such records on every copy of such matter. Provides that proof that such a producer failed to comply with such requirements shall raise a rebuttable presumption that the performers were minors.

titles.title: A bill to restore the record-keeping requirement of the Child Protection and Obscenity Enforcement Act of 1988.
